thread.title: Dozens Injured as Car Plows Into Parade Crowd in New Orleans
thread.title_full: Dozens Injured as Car Plows Into Parade Crowd in New Orleans

title: Dozens Injured as Car Plows Into Parade Crowd in New Orleans
text:
Get short URL 0 23 0 0 More than a dozen are reported injured, many critically, after a car smashed through a crowd watching the Krewe of Endymion parade in New Orlean, Louisiana. 
Some 20 are thought to have been injured in the incident, though there may be more. Police spokeswoman Ambria Washington said "Initial reports show so far about a dozen people are in critical condition," the Daily Star reports. 
The incident occurred as the parade began to pass through the intersection of Carrollton Avenue and Orleans Street, witnesses said. It is unclear if it was a deliberate attack as some witnesses describe the driver as seeming "drunk" and "out of it." The parade is one of the warm up events for the city's huge annual Mardi Gras celebrations. 
DETAILS TO FOLLOW
